intro: Haloragis ciliata, commonly known as the silky willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters. Haloragis ciliata is adapted to saline and arid environments, making it a resilient species in challenging conditions.
